Package model

Class Analyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Analyzer

  • public class Analyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that realizes program logic. Its purpose is to provide functionalities of identyfing errors in HTML files, mark them and correct them.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    4.0
    Author:
    Piotr Gazda

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private static class  Analyzer.ErrorType
      Enum for describing possible error types.

    • Method Detail

      • actualizeErrorsCount

        private void actualizeErrorsCount​(Analyzer.ErrorType errorType)

      • addChar

        private java.lang.String addChar​(java.lang.String str,
                                 char ch,
                                 int position)
        Method to insert a character at a specific index in string.
        Parameters:
        str - String to which the new character will be inserted.
        ch - Character to be inserted.
        position - Position at which the new character will be inserted.
        Returns:
        String with new character at correct position.

      • addErrorInfo

        private java.lang.String addErrorInfo​(java.lang.String erroneous)
        Method adds asterisk to a line containing an error.
        Parameters:
        erroneous - Line containing an error.
        Returns:
        Line with added asterisk.

      • checkCurrentCharacter

        private char checkCurrentCharacter​()
        Auxilliary method to check currentChar and currentCharacter value in context of analyzed lines value.

      • checkEndingTag

        private boolean checkEndingTag​(java.lang.String openingTag)
        Method for checking if the ending tag is correct. It is less complicated than the method checking the opening tag, because it assumes the begging tag is already known.
        Parameters:
        openingTag - Opening tag to know how ending tag should look like.
        Returns:
        True if a correct ending tag has been identified, false otherwise.

      • checkIfEndingTagIsLowercase

        private boolean checkIfEndingTagIsLowercase​(java.lang.String tag)
        Method to check whether a HTML ending tag contains only of lowercase letters.
        Parameters:
        tag - String being the checked ending tag.
        Returns:
        True if the ending tag is all lowercase, false otherwise.

      • checkIfTagIsLowercase

        private boolean checkIfTagIsLowercase​(java.lang.String tag)
        Method to check whether a HTML tag contains only of lowercase letters.
        Parameters:
        tag - String being the checked tag.
        Returns:
        True if the tag is all lowercase, false otherwise.

      • checkOpeningTag

        private boolean checkOpeningTag​()
        Method that checks if an opening tag has ending bracket. It allows multiline tags, but a tag opening bracket before closing the last tag is considered a mistake. It also calls methods for putting error message in correct places (saving it to array for document lines with error information) and for putting missing tag (saving it to array for document lines with errors corrected).
        Returns:
        True if tag is totally correct, false otherwise.

      • checkSingleEndingTagIntegrity

        public boolean checkSingleEndingTagIntegrity​(java.lang.String endingTag)
        Method that allows to check whether given ending tag is proper.
        Parameters:
        endingTag - Given ending tag.
        Returns:
        True if ending tag is correct, false otherwise.

      • checkSingleOpeningTagIntegrity

        public boolean checkSingleOpeningTagIntegrity​(java.lang.String tag)
        Method that allows to check whether given tag is correct.
        Parameters:
        tag - Tag to be checked.
        Returns:
        If tag is correct return true else return false.

      • checkTagPair

        public void checkTagPair​(java.lang.String openingTag,
                         boolean isOpened)
        Recursive method which aims to determine if every opening tag is correctly paired with an ending tag. It iterates over text lines looking for closing tag for its given opening tag. If it encounters another opening tag it calls itself recursively. It also calls methods for putting error message in correct places (saving it to array for document lines with error information) and for putting missing tag (saving it to array for document lines with errors corrected).
        Parameters:
        openingTag - Opening tag that needs to be found a pair. If not given, method iterates over document lines to find one.
        isOpened - Flag to annotate if method works after an opening tag has been found (true) or it needs to find an opening tag (false).

      • getAnalyzedLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAnalyzedLines​()
        Getter for collection containing analyzed document.
        Returns:
        Lines of analyzed document.

      • getCorrectedLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCorrectedLines​()
        Getter for document contents with errors corrected.
        Returns:
        List of strings representing said content.

      • getCurrentLineIndex

        public int getCurrentLineIndex​()
        Getter for index of currently processed line.
        Returns:
        Current line index.

      • getLinesWithErrorInfo

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLinesWithErrorInfo​()
        Getter for document contents with error info added.
        Returns:
        List of strings representing said content.

      • getNoLowercaseTagErrors

        public int getNoLowercaseTagErrors​()
        Getter for noLowercaseTag
        Returns:
        Number of cases when the tag was not in lowercase.

      • getNoMatchingBracketErrors

        public int getNoMatchingBracketErrors​()
        Getter for noMatchingBracketErrors
        Returns:
        Number of cases when there wasn't a matching bracket for a tag.

      • getNoMatchingTagErrors

        public int getNoMatchingTagErrors​()
        Getter for noMatchingTagErrors
        Returns:
        Number of cases when there wasn't a matching ending tag for an opening tag.

      • identifyEndingTag

        private boolean identifyEndingTag​(java.lang.String suspectedTag)
        Method that identifies a string as an closing HTML tag.
        Parameters:
        suspectedTag - The string suspected of being an closing tag.
        Returns:
        True if the string turns out to be an closing tag, false otherwise.

      • identifyOpeningTag

        private boolean identifyOpeningTag​(java.lang.String suspectedTag)
        Method that identifies a string as an opening HTML tag.
        Parameters:
        suspectedTag - The string suspected of being an opening tag.
        Returns:
        True if the string turns out to be an opening tag, false otherwise.

      • insertEndBracket

        private void insertEndBracket​(int lineNumber,
                              int indexAfterEndBracket)
        Method for inserting ending bracket.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - Line number - index in string list.
        indexAfterEndBracket - Index of character before which the ending bracket should be placed.

      • insertEndingTag

        private void insertEndingTag​(int lineNumber,
                             int indexAfterEndTag,
                             java.lang.String tagName)
        Method for inserting ending tag.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - Line number - index in string list.
        indexAfterEndTag - Index of character before which the ending tag should be placed.
        tagName - Opening tag name

      • manageNoEndingBracketError

        private void manageNoEndingBracketError​()
        Method to annotate and correct error of lack of tag ending bracket.

      • manageNoEndingTagError

        private void manageNoEndingTagError​(java.lang.String myOpeningTag)
        Method to annotate and correct error of lack of ending tag.
        Parameters:
        myOpeningTag - Opening tag that lacks ending tag.

      • manageTagNotLowercaseError

        private void manageTagNotLowercaseError​(int beginIdx,
                                        int endIdx)
        Method to manage error of tag not in lowercase.

        Setter for original document lines.
        Parameters:
        newLines - List of strings representing said content.

        private void toLowercase​(int lineNumber,
                         int beginChar,
                         int endChar)
        Method converts string to lowercase.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - Line number - index in string list.
        beginChar - Index of beginning of the string to be converted
        endChar - Index of ending of the string to be converted
